p: Currently, many studies have focused on the evaluation of natural products as the source of novel biologically active compounds, owing to the deficiency of common antimicrobial agents to treat infectious diseases [ 2, 3]. In the last two decades, there has been an increasing attention in the use of medicinal herbs to develop new herbal medicines or nutraceuticals. The herbal medicines are rich in bioactive molecules (e.g., polyphenols, carotenoids, and flavonoids) with therapeutic effects, such as delaying the onset of some diseases like cardiovascular disorders, diabetes, and cancer [ 4].
